site_name: Footpath Adjacent To Kwik Fit Garage
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents: EAL-207 (Existing and Proposed Views); EAL-207 REV A-01A (Location Plan and Block Plan); Proposed Elevations; BT Street Hub Product Statement; BT Street Hub Brochure; Street Hub Anti-Social Behaviour Management Plan V2; BT Street Hub FAQs; Cover Letter prepared by Harlequin Group; Developers Notice prepared by Harlequin Group; Planning Supporting Statement prepared by Harlequin Group

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings listed under condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The advertisement shall change no more frequently than once every 10 seconds and shall not include any animation or exposed cathode tubing. The digital signs shall also not display any moving, or apparently moving, images (including animation, flashing, scrolling three dimensional, intermittent or video elements).

Reason: To protect residential amenity and highway safety, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| The screen shall be designed so that, in the event of breakdown, it shall automatically power off to prevent flashing error messages being displayed, and it shall be so maintained.

Reason: To protect residential amenity and highway safety, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The brightness of the Illuminated Advertisements shall meet with the recommendations made in the Institution of Lighting Professionals Technical Report No 5, Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements.
Reason: To protect the amenity of adjoining premises and area in accordance with policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| -The development hereby approved shall be managed in accordance with Street Hub ASB Management Plan (Revision 2) and shall include the ongoing use of an algorithm to identify repeated anti-social number use, with a review after the first three months of installation between police and BT to assess any issues arising. Any change to the ASB management plan shall be approved by the local planning authority and the Metropolitan Police designing out crime team.
-Specifically, should the free call to mobile or landline facility or USB charging point be deemed to be an identified problem then this facility must be removed and review completed.
-The algorithm 'threshold' shall not be altered without consultation with the MPS designing out crime team.

Reason: To ensure that the proposal does not increase the likelihood of anti-social behaviour and to ensure that crime and disorder, and the fear of crime, do not undermine the quality of life or community cohesion in the area, in accordance with Section 8: Promoting healthy and safe communities of the NPPF (2021); policies D11 of the London Plan (2021); 1.1 (h) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and policies 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013)
| The approved equipment shall be removed from the site when it becomes redundant.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Committee/Delegated Report Application Number: 214668VAR Location: O/S Ibis Hotel 32-38 Uxbridge Road Ealing W5 2BS Development Plan Document (2013), Policies D3 and D4 of The London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| The phone box shown in drawing number EAL-207 REV A-01A (Location Plan and Block Plan) shall be removed prior to the installation of the BT Street Hub.

Reason: To preserve the character and appearance of the site and surrounding area and in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
subdivision_of_building: N/A - streetworks proposal, not building based
description: Installation of BT Street hub (following demolition of existing BT phone box) with associated display of advertisement to both side of the unit
